title: `Could not find a declaration file for module '../src/runtime/control.js'` error when typechecking `svelte.config.js` with `noImplicitAny`
body:
### Describe the bug

by default, type checking seems to be disabled on `svelte.config.js`, despite the fact that it was generated with `@type` jsdocs

```js
import adapter from '@sveltejs/adapter-auto';

/** @type {import('@sveltejs/kit').Config} */
const config = {
	kit: {
		adapter: adapter()
	}
};

export default config;
```

however, attempting to type check it causes the following error:
```
â¯ tsc --allowjs --checkjs --noemit --module esnext --noimplicitany --moduleresolution node .\svelte.config.js
node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/types/index.d.ts:20:37 - error TS7016: Could not find a declaration file for module '../src/runtime/control.js'. '/home/projects/sveltejs-kit-template-default-q26evm/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/runtime/control.js' implicitly has an 'any' type.

20 import { HttpError, Redirect } from '../src/runtime/control.js';
                                       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Found 1 error in node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/types/index.d.ts:20
```
### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/sveltejs-kit-template-default-q26evm?file=svelte.config.js&terminal=dev

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Windows 10 10.0.19044
    CPU: (12) x64 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-11500T @ 1.50GHz
    Memory: 1.52 GB / 15.73 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.10.0 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.EXE
    npm: 8.19.2 - C:\Program Files\nodejs\npm.CMD
  Browsers:
    Edge: Spartan (44.19041.1266.0), Chromium (103.0.1264.62)
    Internet Explorer: 11.0.19041.1566
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.81
    @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.512
    svelte: ^3.44.0 => 3.51.0
    vite: ^3.1.0 => 3.1.7
```


### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

_No response_
